page.name: Suggestions for Further Learning & Course Reference List
page.content:
Other Courses in the LINCS ACP Series

  • ACP: Building a Bridge to Adult Career Pathways
  • ACP: Instructional Considerations for Adult Career Pathways 

Additional Resources

  • Equity and Adult Career Pathways (Office of Community College Research & Leadership)
  • Advancing Racial Equity in Career Pathways (Pham, 2018)
  • Tools for Building Employer-Educator Partnerships (OCTAE, LINCS)

  • CommQuest, a National Reporting System (NRS) self-directed course (log-in required) (OCTAE, NRS)

References

Below is a list of references used in this course.

Bergson-Shilcock, A. (2020, May 20). The new landscape of digital literacy. National Skills Coalition. https://www.nationalskillscoalition.org/resource/publications/the-new-landscape-of-digital-literacy/

Bragg, D., Endel, B., Anderson, N., Soricone, L., & Acevedo, E. (2019). What works for adult learners: Lessons from career pathways evaluations. Jobs for the Future. https://www.jff.org/resources/what-works-adult-learners-lessons-career-pathway-evaluations/

Bureau of Labor Statistics. (2020, December). Employment recovery on the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://www.bls.gov/opub/mlr/2020/article/employment-recovery.htm

Bureau of Labor Statistics. (2021, January 8). The employment situation–December 2020. [News release]. https://www.bls.gov/news.release/archives/empsit_01082021.htm

Center for Occupational Research and Development, and Social Policy Research Associates (2021, January). Introduction to stackable credentials (OCTAE Program Memorandum 21-1). U.S. Department of Education, Office of Career, Technical, and Adult Education. https://s3.amazonaws.com/PCRN/file/introduction-to-stackable-credentials.pdf

Cotner, H., Bragg, D., Cheng, I., Costelloe, S., Freeman, B., Goold, G., Heiser, E., Lemire, S., Miller, D.G., Porowski, A., Van Noy, M., & Yadav, E. (2021). Designing and delivering career pathways at community colleges: A practice guide for educators (WWC 2021007). U.S. Department of Education, Institute of Education Sciences. https://ies.ed.gov/ncee/wwc/Docs/PracticeGuide/WWC-PraxGuide-Career-Pathways-full-text-Final-508.pdf

Dey, M., & Loewenstein, M. (2020, April). How many workers are employed in sectors directly affected by COVID-19 shutdowns, where do they work, and how much do they earn? Monthly Labor Review. Bureau of Labor Statistics. https://doi.org/10.21916/mlr.2020.6.

Gallup & Lumina Foundation. (2014, February 25). What American needs to know about higher education redesign: The 2013 Lumina Study of the American Public’s Opinion on Higher Education and U.S. Business Leaders Poll on Higher Education. Lumina Foundation. http://www.luminafoundation.org/files/resources/2013-gallup-lumina-foundation-report.pdf

Hess, J., & Burnett, J. (2018). Systems building: Practical tools for cultivating partnership health. Presented at the Driving Change: Local Solutions to the National Attainment Challenge conference, Denver, CO.

Pham, D. (2018, October 30). Advancing racial equity in career pathways: Community-centered solutions. Center for Law and Social Policy. https://www.clasp.org/publications/report/brief/advancing-racial-equity-through-career-pathways-community-centered

Rothes, A., Lemos, M. S., & Goncalves, T. (2017). Motivational profiles of adult learners. Adult Education Quarterly, 6(1), 3–29.

U.S. Department of Education. (2015). Tools for building employer—Educator partnerships. LINCS: Literacy Information and Communication System. https://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collections/profile-777

Zamani-Gallaher, E. M. (2020). Ensure students are learning: Equity-minded approaches to teaching and learning (Issue Brief No. 1). Office of Community College Research and Leadership at the University of Illinois. https://old.occrl.illinois.edu/docs/librariesprovider4/ec3p/cccse-occrl-issuebrief-1-final-7_3_20.pdf
